title: Mike Ashley becomes public enemy No1 in Newcastle as it emerges Rafa Benitez could quit the club
text:
'Serial offender' Mike Ashley becomes public enemy No1 in Newcastle as it emerges Rafa Benitez could quit the club 
Toon manager is demanding showdown talks in the summer after club owner failed to buy at all in January By TOBY GANNON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MIKE ASHLEY has become public enemy No1 on Tyneside following the news Rafa Benitez may leave the club. 3 Mike Ashley has become public enemy No1 on Tyneside after Rafa Benitez’s disappointmentover transfers 
Benitez, 56, cannot believe owner Ashley did not loosen the purse-strings to bring in a single player and will demand showdown talks in the summer. 
The Spaniard is massively popular with the Toon Army, who feel he is the best appointment of the Ashley era. 
Many have taken to Twitter to vent about Ashley – though most were unsuitable to publish! 
Here, SunSport picks out the strongest reactions (without causing offence). Sounds like Mike Ashley is up to his old tricks again #Newcastle . 
— Craig Ryan (@craigryansports) February 2, 2017 If it's a choice between Mike Ashley or Rafa Benitez…there's only one winner. There is no good to come with MA still on the scene #NUFC 
— Craig Robson (@CraigRobson_89) February 2, 2017 am with the rest of Newcastle fans if rafa Benitez goes I will never set foot in st James park til l mike Ashley leaves #NUFC 
— Tom Dixon (@tomdixon27) February 2, 2017 Mike Ashley is a serial offender when it comes to making big big mistakes. Hopefully none of our fans have forgot this 
— Richard Smith (@richysmith100) February 2, 2017 If Rafa leaves #nufc @nufc because of Mike Ashley interfering, that's me done with them till he's gone. 
— Paul Elliott (@paulelliott2017) February 2, 2017 Mike Ashley.. You had one job! One. 
— Daniel Garrahan (@DanGarrahan) February 2, 2017 adiós Rafa, well done mike Ashley #nufc 
— Luke Allen (@lukeallen1234) February 2, 2017 Related Stories Rafa raging Rafa Benitez's future at Newcastle in doubt as he questions club's failure to make any January signings TICKET FAIL Footie fan gets 56 separate tickets when splitting his train ticket from Newcastle to Oxford to save cash OLD PALS ACT Newcastle legend Shola Ameobi offered chance to resurrect career at Notts County by Kevin Nolan TOON CIAR CRASH Newcastle 2 QPR 2: Ciaran Clark's last-minute own goal stops Toon returning top of the table Clark scare Newcastle's Ciaran Clark comes off for several minutes after being on the ground with a head injury v QPR 
Benitez does not wish to quit Newcastle mid-season as he is confident he can return the club to the Premier League. 
But the Spaniard wants assurances he is in control of spending. 
The failure to re-sign Andros Townsend, and a back-up for Jonjo Shelvey, has left Benitez frustrated. Getty Images Rafa Benitez could walk out of Newcastle in the summer if he is not given assurances over spending Reuters 3 QPR drew 2-2 at Newcastle on Wednesday to cause more unease on Tyneside 
Now he goes into the business end of the season with less firepower than he had hoped for. 
Wednesday’s draw at home to QPR meant Newcastle failed to reclaim top spot. 
It also adds a growing unease on Tyneside. Oxford 3-0 Newcastle : Oxford through to fifth round for first time in 23 years
